name: PAPARA(ZZ)I
tagline: Program for Annotation of Photographs and Rapid Analysis (of Zillions and Zillions) of Images
body:
PAPARA(ZZ)I is an open-source program for annotating marine still imagery data. Images can be annotated using either free points, random points or gridded points. The compiled versions run under 64-bit Windows, Mac OS X and Linux systems. Alternativelly, PAPARA(ZZ)I can be run from MATLAB directly.

### Designer Templates
We’ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.

### Contact
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Authors
PAPARA(ZZ)I was developed by [Yann Marcon](Yann.Marcon@awi.de) and [Autun Purser](Autun.Purser@awi.de).

### Support
Having trouble with PAPARA(ZZ)I? A pdf version of the user manual is provided with the program on the [PAPARA(ZZ)I](https://github.com/PAPARA-ZZ-I) GitHub repository. If it does not help, contact us and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
